lead_paragraph: Alexei Ulyukayev, the minister of economic development, was detained on charges of soliciting $2 million as a thank-you for endorsing an oil deal.

byline.contributor: Ivan Nechepurenko and Sophia Kishkovsky contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: Russia Charges Minister in an Oil Bribery Scandal
headline.main: In a Late-Night Move, Russia Arrests a Top Economic Official in a Bribery Case

snippet: Alexei Ulyukayev, the minister of economic development, was detained on charges of soliciting $2 million as a thank-you for endorsing an oil deal....
abstract: Russian economic development Min Aleksei Ulyukayev is detained in middle of night and charged with soliciting $2 million bribe from state oil giant Rosneft; is country's highest-level official arrested in decades and incident reflects battle within ruling elite over direction of Russian economy.
